training.trainer.rep_trainer module¶

An algorithm that uses RMSProp and representatives selection for incremental learning

training.trainer.trainer module¶

Module for training a neural network. Features:

  1. It’s independent of the dataset, or model used for training

  2. Does all the needed preparations for the training (e.g. creating a session)

class training.trainer.trainer.Trainer(config: training.config.general_config.GeneralConfig, model: libs.caffe_tensorflow.network.Network, pipeline: etl.data.data.Data, tensor_x: tensorflow.python.framework.ops.Tensor, tensor_y: tensorflow.python.framework.ops.Tensor, tester: experiments.tester.Tester = None, checkpoint: str = None)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Has the purpose of training a generic net, with a generic configuration. It serves as a base for custom trainers

train()¶

Trains a neural network with the appropriate configuration. It also does the preparations needed for that training. It loads a checkpoint if a valid checkpoint path has been given.

Returns

None

train_megabatch(megabatch: int, iteration: int, total_iteration: int, trained_time: float, ttime: float, config: training.config.general_config.GeneralConfig, writer: tensorflow.python.summary.writer.writer.FileWriter, data_x: tensorflow.python.framework.ops.Tensor, data_y: tensorflow.python.framework.ops.Tensor)¶

Trains a neural network over an increment of data, with the given configuration and model, over the data that is provided. It also saves summaries for TensorBoard and creates checkpoints according to the given configuration. Note: if both maximum number of epochs and maximum time are set, then the training finishes when any of the stop criteria is met

Parameters

  • megabatch – the number of the mega-batch

  • iteration – the current iteration number over the training data. It should be zero if no checkpoint has been loaded or if the mega-batch at which the restored checkpoint is differs from the current mega-batch

  • total_iteration – the current iteration number over the training data, counting from the start of the training (that is, from the first batch of mega-batch 0)

  • trained_time – number of seconds that the network has been trained (counting from the start of the mega-batch). It should be zero if no checkpoint has been loaded or if the current mega-batch is different than the one that was loaded from a checkpoint

  • ttime – number of seconds that the model should be trained. If None, then time restrictions are not used

  • config – the configuration for the whole training

  • writer – a FileWriter properly configured

  • data_x – the tensor associated with the training data

  • data_y – the tensor that has the corresponding labels of the training data

Returns

the current iteration

Return type

int
